meanings.definition: Relating to the scientific description of peoples and cultures.
meanings.sent1: The ethnographically diverse museum showcased artifacts from various cultures.
meanings.sent2: She conducted an ethnographically accurate study on tribal rituals.
meanings.sent3: The ethnographically decorated room made the guests feel like they were traveling the world.
meanings.sent4: His ethnographically detailed map of cultural regions was a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The ethnographically inspired fashion show celebrated global diversity.

meanings.definition: In a manner that involves studying and recording the customs and traditions of different societies.
meanings.sent1: She observed the community ethnographically, taking notes on their traditions.
meanings.sent2: The anthropologist documented the tribe's rituals ethnographically.
meanings.sent3: He comically tried to dance ethnographically like the locals, much to their amusement.
meanings.sent4: The music festival captured the essence of unity ethnographically.
meanings.sent5: The film portrayed the journey of self-discovery ethnographically.
